title: Going Open Source: System Architecture & Algorithms
description: A deep dive into the mathematical models behind the procedural background engine. Documenting the 3D-to-2D projection matrices, recursive circuit generation, the quantum entanglement logic, the challenges faced, and the lessons learned along the way.

title: Deterministic Architecture: Input-Lockstep & Data-Driven Tooling
description: Analyzing the bandwidth efficiency of deterministic state synchronization vs. snapshot interpolation. Plus, a look at decoupling gameplay logic using ScriptableObjects for rapid prototyping. Read on to find out what's up.

title: System Architecture: Evaluating Web & Native Security Constraints
description: An architectural post-mortem on browser sandboxing limits, and the strategic pivot to a Rust-based (Tauri) local-first ecosystem.

title: Multiplayer Sync: A Post-Mortem on Bandwidth & State Management
description: Analyzing the architectural challenges of real-time state synchronization in a server-authoritative environment. A deep dive into race conditions, O(n^2) performance bottlenecks, and the cost of over-engineering. Read on to find out what's up.

title: Performance Case Study: Optimizing Canvas for Mobile
description: Initial load testing revealed significant thermal throttling on mobile devices due to uncapped Canvas re-renders. The goal is to maintain visual fidelity without melting the user's CPU. Here's an Optimization Report on the performance challenges of using Canvas for procedural backgrounds, and the midnight patch that saved the day.

title: Product Vision: The 'Terminal' Design System
description: Defining the design philosophy and technical constraints for a performance-first, zero-tracker personal platform. Why I chose a custom Markdown engine over standard CMS solutions. This site didn't take two years to build. It took me two years to become someone who could finish it.

title: Engineered from Scratch: A High-Performance 2D Game Engine in Rust
description: A technical deep-dive into building a cross-platform rendering engine. Architected using Rust, wGPU, and a custom Entity Component System (ECS) to achieve sub-16ms frame times. Features a decoupled rendering pipeline that targets both native desktop and WebAssembly (WASM) from a single codebase.
